intro: Calamus erioacanthus, commonly known as the hairy thorned reed, is a member of the Aroid family (Araceae). It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stems that are often covered in fine, hairy structures. Its leaves are large, lance-shaped, and typically have a rough, textured surface. Calamus erioacanthus produces striking inflorescences consisting of a spadix surrounded by a colorful spathe, which is a common feature among aroid plants.
